description:
When the marker parameter is passed, the expected behavior is that all items that logically appear "after" the marker. The system is currently returning the item that is passed as the marker as well, which causes recursive loops when trying to create pagination through the results, as using marker does not advance the list.

curl -ik -H "X-Auth-Token: 6885b39a-b301-444e-93cc-77d6d2ffb48f" https://127.0.0.1/v2/658803/flavors?limit=1
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Date: Fri, 09 Mar 2012 21:24:55 GMT
Content-Length: 369
Content-Type: application/json
X-Compute-Request-Id: req-aeb76f85-23c6-43b2-ab43-3ef0a80099a5
Server: Jetty(8.0.y.z-SNAPSHOT)

{"flavors": [{"id": "6", "links": [{"href": "https://127.0.0.1/v2/658803/flavors/6", "rel": "self"}, {"href": "https://127.0.0.1/658803/flavors/6", "rel": "bookmark"}], "name": "8GB instance"}], "flavors_links": [{"href": "https://127.0.0.1/v2/658803/flavors?limit=1&marker=6", "rel": "next"}]}

Daryls-MacBook-Pro:tempest dwalleck$ curl -ik -H "X-Auth-Token: 6885b39a-b301-444e-93cc-77d6d2ffb48f" https://127.0.0.1/v2/658803/flavors?limit=1&marker=6

{"flavors": [{"id": "6", "links": [{"href": "https://127.0.0.1/v2/658803/flavors/6", "rel": "self"}, {"href": "https://127.0.0.1/658803/flavors/6", "rel": "bookmark"}], "name": "8GB instance"}], "flavors_links": [{"href": "https://127.0.0.1/v2/658803/flavors?limit=1&marker=6", "rel": "next"}]}

comments.content: I tested on servers, images and flavors and was unable to reproduce this behavior. Judging from the code, it looks like it should return the items after the marker (up to the limit) since common.limited_by_marker loops through the list of resources  until it finds the marker and returns a a slice of the list from that index +1 to the limit.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~philip-knouff

comments.content:
curl -ik -H "X-Auth-Token: 6885b39a-b301-444e-93cc-77d6d2ffb48f" https://127.0.0.1/v2/658803/flavors?limit=1&marker=6
the linux shell may treat above cmd line as:
(1)curl -ik -H "X-Auth-Token: 6885b39a-b301-444e-93cc-77d6d2ffb48f" https://127.0.0.1/v2/658803/flavors?limit=1, (2)marker=6
so the result is the same as:
curl -ik -H "X-Auth-Token: 6885b39a-b301-444e-93cc-77d6d2ffb48f" https://127.0.0.1/v2/658803/flavors?limit=1
I think you should run the first cmd line with 'marker=6' like this(with double quotations around the URL):
curl -ik -H "X-Auth-Token: 6885b39a-b301-444e-93cc-77d6d2ffb48f" "https://127.0.0.1/v2/658803/flavors?limit=1&marker=6"
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hzwangpan
